channel.title: Movie Reviews on 无关紧要的宇宙
channel.description: Recent content in Movie Reviews on 无关紧要的宇宙

item.title: ‘H Is for Hawk’ Review: Claire Foy and Her Bird Fly High in a Tender but Overlong Grief Drama
item.description: Following the death of her beloved father, a Cambridge academic decides to raise a goshawk in director Philippa Lowthorpe’s adaptation of the bestselling memoir by Helen Macdonald.

item.title: ‘H Is for Hawk’ Review: Claire Foy and Her Bird Fly High in a Tender but Overlong Grief Drama
item.description: Following the death of her beloved father, a Cambridge academic decides to raise a goshawk in director Philippa Lowthorpe’s adaptation of the bestselling memoir by Helen Macdonald.

item.title: ‘Ask E. Jean’ Review: Trump Accuser E. Jean Carroll Reclaims the Spotlight on Her Own Terms in Flawed but Sympathetic Doc
item.description: Director Ivy Meeropol profiles the journalist and advice columnist who sued the president in 2019, ultimately being awarded $88.3 million in damages by a jury.

item.title: ‘Ask E. Jean’ Review: Trump Accuser E. Jean Carroll Reclaims the Spotlight on Her Own Terms in Flawed but Sympathetic Doc
item.description: Director Ivy Meeropol profiles the journalist and advice columnist who sued the president in 2019, ultimately being awarded $88.3 million in damages by a jury.

item.title: ‘Ballad of a Small Player’ Review: Colin Farrell’s Charm Can’t Save Edward Berger’s Hollow Redemption Tale
item.description: Tilda Swinton and Fala Chen also star in the latest feature by the ‘Conclave’ director, about a gambling addict hiding from the authorities and his debtors in the casinos of Macau.

item.description: Tilda Swinton and Fala Chen also star in the latest feature by the ‘Conclave’ director, about a gambling addict hiding from the authorities and his debtors in the casinos of Macau.

item.title: ‘The New Yorker at 100’ Review: Netflix Doc Is Entertaining and Star-Studded, but the Storied Magazine Deserved More Depth
item.description: Marshall Curry’s film features an assortment of New Yorker luminaries, as well as stars like Sarah Jessica Parker and Jon Hamm, all celebrating the magazine’s recent anniversary.

item.description: Marshall Curry’s film features an assortment of New Yorker luminaries, as well as stars like Sarah Jessica Parker and Jon Hamm, all celebrating the magazine’s recent anniversary.

item.title: ‘The Last Viking’ Review: Mads Mikkelsen Is Funny and Poignant in Danish Crime Comedy About Delusion and Brotherly Love
item.description: Revolving around an unusual pair of brothers, Anders Thomas Jensen’s latest absurdist feature premiered in Venice out of competition.

item.title: ‘Everywhere Man: The Lives and Times of Peter Asher’ Review: Documentary Traces a Remarkable Under-the-Radar Musical Legacy
item.description: From James Taylor to Linda Ronstadt to Twiggy to Eric Idle, directors Dan Geller and Dayna Goldfine bring out the stars to chronicle Peter Asher’s musical journey.

item.title: ‘Hamlet’ Review: Riz Ahmed Tackles Shakespeare’s Most Famous Hero in a Shaky Contemporary Version
item.description: Set in the Indian community in London, the Telluride-premiering film relies (mostly) on the Bard’s language.

item.description: Mia Goth and Christoph Waltz also star in a grand-scale passion project for Netflix that the iconoclastic director has been gestating for decades.

item.title: ‘Late Fame’ Review: Willem Dafoe Is Low-Key and Magnificent as a Former Poet Seemingly Rescued From Obscurity
item.description: Greta Lee also stars in Kent Jones’ New York-set drama, adapted by Samy Burch from a novella by Arthur Schnitzler, and headed for the New York Film Festival after its Venice premiere.

item.description: Greta Lee also stars in Kent Jones’ New York-set drama, adapted by Samy Burch from a novella by Arthur Schnitzler, and headed for the New York Film Festival after its Venice premiere.

item.title: ‘No Other Choice’ Review: Park Chan-wook’s Satirical Thriller Is a Visual Delight That Sacrifices Its Edge to Slapstick
item.description: Lee Byung-hun, who starred in the Korean director’s breakout hit ‘Joint Security Area’ and more recently in ‘Squid Game,’ plays a desperate man turned ruthless by unemployment.

item.description: The latest feature by the Venice Golden Lion winner was lensed for over three years at Pompeii and communities around the Gulf of Naples.

item.description: Maggie O’Farrell co-wrote the adaptation of her acclaimed novel, a fictionalized account of the Bard and his wife as they fall in love, start a family and then face unexpected tragedy.

item.description: The latest from writer-director Valérie Donzelli (‘Declaration of War’) stars Bastien Bouillon (‘The Night of the 12th’) as a novelist eking out a living as a freelance handyman in Paris.

item.description: Paula Andrea González-Nasser’s first film follows a location scout trying to find meaning in her own existence as she slips in and out of people’s homes.

item.title: ‘The Scout’ Review: Modest but Accomplished Debut Brings a New York Location Scout’s Routines to Lovely, Low-Key Life
item.description: Paula Andrea González-Nasser’s first film follows a location scout trying to find meaning in her own existence as she slips in and out of people’s homes.

item.title: ‘GEN_’ Review: A Compassionate Portrait of an Italian Doctor Treating Both Trans Patients and Women Trying to Conceive
item.description: The latest documentary from filmmaker Gianluca Matarrese (‘Everything Must Go’) premiered earlier this year in Sundance and was recently showcased at Karlovy Vary.

item.title: ‘GEN_’ Review: A Compassionate Portrait of an Italian Doctor Treating Both Trans Patients and Women Trying to Conceive
item.description: The latest documentary from filmmaker Gianluca Matarrese (‘Everything Must Go’) premiered earlier this year in Sundance and was recently showcased at Karlovy Vary.
